title: Greek yogurt (0%) and Carrots Bake with Pepper & Asparagus
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 170°C.
Toss carrots and asparagus with half the rapeseed oil, salt, pepper and harissa; spread on a tray.
Season greek yogurt (0%) and place on the tray. Roast for 45 min, turning once.
Cook baby potatoes until tender (20–25 min boiled).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Baby potatoes or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Spanish Black beans with Sweet potato & Courgette with Black Beans & Beans
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 180°C.
Toss courgette and peppers with half the almonds, salt, pepper and thai green curry paste; spread on a tray.
Season black beans and place on the tray. Roast for 32 min, turning once.
Cook sweet potato until tender (18–25 min roasted).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Sweet potato or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Turkey breast and Peppers Pan-Fry with Turkey & Spaghetti
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat peanut butter in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook turkey breast 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry peppers and onion with thai green curry paste 22 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the spaghetti according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Turkey for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Spaghetti or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Spanish Prawns with Pitta & Green beans with Beans & Pepper
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the air fryer to 180°C.
Toss green beans and garlic with half the peanut butter, salt, pepper and smoked paprika + cumin; spread on a tray.
Season prawns and place on the tray. Air-fry for 31 min, turning once.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Prawns for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Pitta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Pork tenderloin and Peas Stir-Fry with Pork & Courgette
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook pork tenderloin 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry peas and courgette with lemon & herb 15 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook baby potatoes until tender (20–25 min boiled).
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Pork for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Baby potatoes or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: American Chickpeas traybake with Chickpeas & Rice Tray Bake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat walnuts in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook chickpeas 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry garlic and onion with ras el hanout 9 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the brown rice according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Brown rice or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Lentils Thai green curry paste plate with Lentils & Quinoa
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 210°C.
Toss spinach and cabbage with half the ghee, salt, pepper and thai green curry paste; spread on a tray.
Season lentils and place on the tray. Roast for 33 min, turning once.
Cook the quinoa according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Quinoa or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Dutch Paneer traybake with Paneer & Beans Tray Bake
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat butter in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook paneer 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry aubergine and green beans with smoked paprika + cumin 21 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the spaghetti according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Spaghetti or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Chicken breast Garam masala plate with Chicken & Couscous
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Prepare the fresh components on a board.
Mix chicken breast with garam masala and a pinch of salt.
Layer with spinach, kale and couscous.
Cook the couscous according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Chicken for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Couscous or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Eggs Cajun blend bowl with Eggs & Pasta
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat almonds in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook eggs 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry broccoli and cabbage with cajun blend 5 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the whole-wheat pasta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Whole-wheat pasta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.
